basics.name: Youssef Hussein
basics.label: Graduate Research Assistant and Fellow
basics.summary: A graduate research assistant at University of Minnesota researching big data systems with a focus on big spatial data.

work.name: University of Minnesota - Twin Cities
work.position: Graduate Research Assistant (Supervised by Prof. Mohamed Mokbel)
work.summary: Conducting research in the area of Big Data Management and Systems Architecture focusing on SpatioTemporal Data.

description: Developed and presented a web portal (iharpv.cs.umn.edu) for interactively querying and visualizing raster data.
Building a suitcase of LLMs analogous to HuggingFace to build and extend multiple trajectory operations.
Packaging the system in an extensible easy-to-use python library pypi.org/project/KAFYTraj/

work.name: The American University in Cairo (Computer Science Department)
work.position: Junior Research Assistant (Supervised by Dr. Nouri Sakr)

description: Tackled a dual-criticality scheduling challenge in online and offline contexts utilizing multiple Reinforcement Learning (RL) models.
Developed RL models using OpenAI Gym, RLlib, and Stable Baselines, involving the creation of over 5000 lines of Python code.
Evaluated model performance and Hyperparameter Tuning, leveraging TensorFlow and TensorBoard for analysis.

work.name: The American University in Cairo (Construction Engineering Department)
work.position: Research Engineer (Supervised by Prof. Osama Hosny)

description: Led the development of an embedded application for a multidisciplinary research project integrating four subsystems to support sustainable land farming while minimizing water consumption.
Utilized Python libraries, such as Beautiful Soup and Pandas, to extract real-time data.

education.institution: University of Minnesota - Twin Cities, Minnesota, USA
The American University in Cairo, Egypt
education.studyType: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering, Minor in Mathematics and Arabic Studies
